trans-unit.source: Get ready to configure MAM policies | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Get ready to configure MAM policies | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the pre-requisites and setting up users before you can create mobile app management policies.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the pre-requisites and setting up users before you can create mobile app management policies.

trans-unit.source: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topic describes what you need to do before you can create mobile app management (MAM) policies in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes what you need to do before you can create mobile app management (MAM) policies in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal is the new admin console for creating MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal is the new admin console for creating MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you use this portal to create MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you use this portal to create MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal supports the following MAM scenarios:
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal supports the following MAM scenarios:

trans-unit.source: Devices that are enrolled in Intune
trans-unit.target: Devices that are enrolled in Intune

trans-unit.source: Devices that are managed by a third-party MDM solution
trans-unit.target: Devices that are managed by a third-party MDM solution

trans-unit.source: Devices that are not managed by any MDM solution (BYOD)
trans-unit.target: Devices that are not managed by any MDM solution (BYOD)

trans-unit.source: If you are new to using the Azure portal, read the [Azure portal for Microsoft Intune MAM policies](azure-portal-for-microsoft-intune-mam-policies.md) topic to get a quick overview.
trans-unit.target: If you are new to using the Azure portal, read the [Azure portal for Microsoft Intune MAM policies](azure-portal-for-microsoft-intune-mam-policies.md) topic to get a quick overview.

trans-unit.source: If you are currently using the Intune admin console to manage your devices, you can create MAM policies that support apps for devices enrolled in Intune by using the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: If you are currently using the Intune admin console to manage your devices, you can create MAM policies that support apps for devices enrolled in Intune by using the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: But we recommend that you use the Azure portal, even for devices that are enrolled in Intune.
trans-unit.target: But we recommend that you use the Azure portal, even for devices that are enrolled in Intune.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to create a MAM policy by using the Intune admin console, see [Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to create a MAM policy by using the Intune admin console, see [Configure and deploy mobile application management policies in the Microsoft Intune console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).

trans-unit.source: You may not see all MAM policy settings in the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: You may not see all MAM policy settings in the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: If you create MAM policies in both the Intune admin console and the Azure portal, the policy in the Azure portal is applied to the apps and deployed to users.
trans-unit.target: If you create MAM policies in both the Intune admin console and the Azure portal, the policy in the Azure portal is applied to the apps and deployed to users.

trans-unit.source: MAM policies that are created in the Intune admin console cannot be imported into the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: MAM policies that are created in the Intune admin console cannot be imported into the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The MAM policies must be re-created in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The MAM policies must be re-created in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Supported platforms
trans-unit.target: Supported platforms

trans-unit.source: iOS 8.1 or later
trans-unit.target: iOS 8.1 or later

trans-unit.source: Android 4 or later
trans-unit.target: Android 4 or later

trans-unit.source: Windows devices are currently not supported.
trans-unit.target: Windows devices are currently not supported.

trans-unit.source: Supported apps
trans-unit.target: Supported apps

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft apps:** These apps have the Intune App SDK built in and require no further processing before you apply MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft apps:** These apps have the Intune App SDK built in and require no further processing before you apply MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: To see the full list of supported Microsoft apps, go to the [Microsoft Intune mobile application gallery](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx) on the Microsoft Intune application partners page.
trans-unit.target: To see the full list of supported Microsoft apps, go to the [Microsoft Intune mobile application gallery](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/partners.aspx) on the Microsoft Intune application partners page.

trans-unit.source: Click an app to see the supported scenarios and platforms, and to see whether the app supports multiple identities.
trans-unit.target: Click an app to see the supported scenarios and platforms, and to see whether the app supports multiple identities.

trans-unit.source: **Your organization's line-of-business apps:** These require preparing the apps to include the Intune App SDK before you can apply MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: **Your organization's line-of-business apps:** These require preparing the apps to include the Intune App SDK before you can apply MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: For devices that are managed by Intune, see [Decide how to prepare apps for MAM](decide-how-to-prepare-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For devices that are managed by Intune, see [Decide how to prepare apps for MAM](decide-how-to-prepare-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: For devices that are not managed (like employee-owned devices), or for devices that are managed by a third-party mobile device management solution, see [Protect line-of-business apps and data on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For devices that are not managed (like employee-owned devices), or for devices that are managed by a third-party mobile device management solution, see [Protect line-of-business apps and data on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: *Before* you can configure MAM policies, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: *Before* you can configure MAM policies, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: A subscription to Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: A subscription to Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Users need [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] licenses to get apps that have MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: Users need [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] licenses to get apps that have MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: An Office 365 subscription, which is required for the following:
trans-unit.target: An Office 365 subscription, which is required for the following:

trans-unit.source: To apply MAM policies to apps with multiple-identity support.
trans-unit.target: To apply MAM policies to apps with multiple-identity support.

trans-unit.source: To create SharePoint Online and Exchange Online work accounts.
trans-unit.target: To create SharePoint Online and Exchange Online work accounts.

trans-unit.source: Exchange on-premises and SharePoint on-premises are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Exchange on-premises and SharePoint on-premises are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Skype for Business Online setup for modern authentication.
trans-unit.target: Skype for Business Online setup for modern authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Enable modern authentication](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/34339.skype-for-business-online-enable-your-tenant-for-modern-authentication.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Enable modern authentication](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/34339.skype-for-business-online-enable-your-tenant-for-modern-authentication.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to create users.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to create users.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD authenticates users when they open the app and enter their work credentials.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD authenticates users when they open the app and enter their work credentials.

trans-unit.source: If you are setting up users by using the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console, be aware that the MAM policy configuration is moving to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: If you are setting up users by using the [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] console, be aware that the MAM policy configuration is moving to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: To use this portal, you need to set up Azure AD user groups by using the Office 365 portal.
trans-unit.target: To use this portal, you need to set up Azure AD user groups by using the Office 365 portal.

trans-unit.source: Create users and assign Microsoft Intune licenses
trans-unit.target: Create users and assign Microsoft Intune licenses

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you have an Intune subscription.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you have an Intune subscription.

trans-unit.source: You already have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription if you are currently using [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to manage your devices.
trans-unit.target: You already have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription if you are currently using [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to manage your devices.

trans-unit.source: You also have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription if you have purchased an Enterprise Mobility Suite (EMS) license.
trans-unit.target: You also have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription if you have purchased an Enterprise Mobility Suite (EMS) license.

trans-unit.source: If you are trying [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to check out the MAM capabilities, you can get a trial account on the [Microsoft Intune webpage](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/).
trans-unit.target: If you are trying [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] to check out the MAM capabilities, you can get a trial account on the [Microsoft Intune webpage](http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/microsoft-intune/).

trans-unit.source: To check whether you have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription, in the Office portal, go to the **Billing** page.
trans-unit.target: To check whether you have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] subscription, in the Office portal, go to the **Billing** page.

trans-unit.source: You should see [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] as **Active** in the subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: You should see [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] as **Active** in the subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Office portal](http://portal.office.com) with your admin credentials.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Office portal](http://portal.office.com) with your admin credentials.

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Active Users** page to add users and assign [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] licenses.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Active Users** page to add users and assign [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] licenses.

trans-unit.source: Active Users page in the Office portal
trans-unit.target: Active Users page in the Office portal

trans-unit.source: Edit user page in the Office portal
trans-unit.target: Edit user page in the Office portal

trans-unit.source: To give a user the ability to access the Office portal, the Azure AD portal, and the Azure portal, assign the **Global administrator** role to the user.
trans-unit.target: To give a user the ability to access the Office portal, the Azure AD portal, and the Azure portal, assign the **Global administrator** role to the user.

trans-unit.source: Page for editing user roles in the Office portal
trans-unit.target: Page for editing user roles in the Office portal

trans-unit.source: MAM policies are deployed to user groups in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: MAM policies are deployed to user groups in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To create user groups for your MAM policies, go to the **Groups** page in the Office portal and choose the **Add a group option** in the top menu to create a new security group.
trans-unit.target: To create user groups for your MAM policies, go to the **Groups** page in the Office portal and choose the **Add a group option** in the top menu to create a new security group.

trans-unit.source: Type a name and a description, and then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name and a description, and then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: When the group is created, you can add users to the group by clicking **Edit members**.
trans-unit.target: When the group is created, you can add users to the group by clicking **Edit members**.

trans-unit.source: The security group is created in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The security group is created in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Page for security groups in the Office portal
trans-unit.target: Page for security groups in the Office portal

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the roles and permissions that you can assign to admin users.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the roles and permissions that you can assign to admin users.

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: Permissions
trans-unit.target: Permissions

trans-unit.source: Global administrator (Office 365 portal)
trans-unit.target: Global administrator (Office 365 portal)

trans-unit.source: Access to the Office 365 portal and the Azure AD portal.
trans-unit.target: Access to the Office 365 portal and the Azure AD portal.

trans-unit.source: Access to the Azure portal (can do both role management and mobile app management tasks).
trans-unit.target: Access to the Azure portal (can do both role management and mobile app management tasks).

trans-unit.source: Owner (Azure portal)
trans-unit.target: Owner (Azure portal)

trans-unit.source: Access to the Azure portal (can do both role management and mobile app management tasks).
trans-unit.target: Access to the Azure portal (can do both role management and mobile app management tasks).

trans-unit.source: Contributor (Azure portal)
trans-unit.target: Contributor (Azure portal)

trans-unit.source: Access to the Azure portal (can do only the mobile app management tasks).
trans-unit.target: Access to the Azure portal (can do only the mobile app management tasks).

trans-unit.source: Assign the contributor role to a user
trans-unit.target: Assign the contributor role to a user

trans-unit.source: Global administrators have access to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).
trans-unit.target: Global administrators have access to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com).

trans-unit.source: If you want other admin users to be able to configure policies and do other mobile app management tasks, you can assign the contributor role to the users:
trans-unit.target: If you want other admin users to be able to configure policies and do other mobile app management tasks, you can assign the contributor role to the users:

trans-unit.source: On the **Settings** blade, in the **Resource management** section, click **Users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Settings** blade, in the **Resource management** section, click **Users**.

trans-unit.source: Users blade in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Users blade in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** to open the **Add access** blade.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** to open the **Add access** blade.

trans-unit.source: Click **Select a role**, and then click **Contributor**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Select a role**, and then click **Contributor**.

trans-unit.source: Select a role blade in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Select a role blade in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Click **Add user**, and search for the user by name or email address.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add user**, and search for the user by name or email address.

trans-unit.source: The users that you see in this list are the first 1,000 users that you previously created in Azure AD by using the Office portal.
trans-unit.target: The users that you see in this list are the first 1,000 users that you previously created in Azure AD by using the Office portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** on the **Add access** blade to save and assign the role to the user.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** on the **Add access** blade to save and assign the role to the user.

trans-unit.source: Add users blade in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Add users blade in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: If you select a user who does not have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] license assigned to them, they will not be able to access the portal.
trans-unit.target: If you select a user who does not have an [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] license assigned to them, they will not be able to access the portal.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
